text: Looking through the comments, I see people saying their opinions on which soundtrack was better (the SNES version or the GBA version). Other people are telling that the person's opinion is wrong. But really, who cares what other people think? It is their opinion, which they are entitled to. If you don't agree, that is okay. This is what freedom of speech is all about: sharing your thoughts with other people and NOT being thought differently because of said opinion.

text:
When I played the SNES version of DKC3, I always felt it's soundtrack was lackluster in comparison to those in DKC and DKC2. But when I heard it's "Water World", I was like "Finally! An awesome song!".

But then I played the GBA version and heard this version, and it's like "... Wow". The SNES "Water World" doesn't even compare, as good as it was.

text: masterofhobbiton - You guys are insane. This sounds like aerobics music; the SNES version was a masterpiece.
author: 0rcryst

text: This is a pretty good song, but the music on the GBA version of DKC3 isn't anywhere NEAR as good as that on the SNES game. Absolutely not. The forest music especially, the beautiful atmospheric flute song got turned into a happy bouncy tune.
author: Vook

text: Amen to that.
author: RaccoonSam

text: Wise's redoing of the soundtrack wasn't really to my liking outside of this track and the dock one.  Most of the new tracks were fairly mediocre compared to the stuff he did for DKC1-2.

text: I heard the music in this version of the game was completely different from the SNES version. I only know the SNES version, but this one sounds nice. I'll have to seek out the full sopundtrack and check it out.

text:
David Wise didn't contribute a lot to the SNES version, however he came back for the GBA version and remade the entire OST.
In this song there's a part from SNES DKC's Aquatic Ambience. :P
